body: Tagging @erikamenezes (author of https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/pull/217 which introduced the json1 format).
#217 seems not to support document classification. We should consider supporting it.
@icoxfog417 I wonder if we should by default always dereference foreign-keys in the serializers, i.e. always replace the ID with something more human readable like a text field.
@c-w It sounds good. So far as I know any dataset is labeled by its name, not by id except anonymized case (like Kaggle). @Hironsan is there any case that id is preferred than name?
@c-w Label names are really more convenient, and the problem is that label downloads are not available in the document classification, and there is no label-corresponding ID

For anyone else that runs into this, at least one work around to get the name to id relationship (as a CSV) from a running container is:

```bash
docker exec -i doccano /bin/bash - << EOF
python -c '
import sqlite3
conn = sqlite3.connect("app/db.sqlite3")
# Must replace your project_id here (e.g. from url in web app)
rows = conn.execute("SELECT id, text FROM api_label WHERE project_id = 1;").fetchall()
print("\n".join([",".join(map(str, r)) for r in rows]))
'
EOF
> 1,my_label_1
> 2,my_label_2
> 3,my_label_3
> ... etc
```

@eric-czech thanks, here is the same as dict:

```
docker exec -i doccano /bin/bash - << EOF
python -c '
import sqlite3
conn = sqlite3.connect("app/db.sqlite3")
# Must replace your project_id here (e.g. from url in web app)
rows = conn.execute("SELECT id, text FROM api_label WHERE project_id = 5;").fetchall()
print({k: v for k,v in rows})
'
EOF
```

Do not forget to adjust the project id :)

> 对于遇到此问题的其他任何人，至少有一个解决方法是从正在运行的容器中获取名称到ID关系（作为CSV）：
> 
> ```shell
> 搬运工EXEC -i doccano /斌/庆典 - <<  EOF
> 蟒蛇-c' 
> 进口sqlite3的
> 康恩= sqlite3.connect（“应用程序/ db.sqlite3”）
> ＃这里必须更换你的PROJECT_ID（例如，从网应用程序的URL）
> 行=康恩.execute（“SELECT id，text FROM api_label WHERE project_id = 1;”）。fetchall（）
> print（“\ n”.join（[“，”。join（map（str，str） r））对于行中的r]））
> ' 
> EOF
>  > 1，my_label_1
>   > 2，my_label_2
>   > 3，my_label_3
>   > ......等
> ```

What should I do if I'm not using docker

@pogevip,

Access your doccano's database and execute the SQL statement as mentioned above (eg. `SELECT id, text FROM api_label WHERE project_id = 5;`). Once you have the query results  you could copy and paste them into a text document for your own reference.

issue.title: Ids description

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
We can download JSONL file with markup information but unfortunately, there is some ids used: user id, label id. But there is no convenient way to receive information about user name from user id, label name from label id. But you are adding texts in the result even though there is text id in the result file.
Maybe, it would be more useful to return in JSONL file with markup information only ids but add an opportunity to download another file with information about such connections: 
user id --> user name (for users which participated in a markup of the project)
label id --> label name
text id --> text

body:
> @eric-czech thanks, here is the same as dict:
> 
> ```
> docker exec -i doccano /bin/bash - << EOF
> python -c '
> import sqlite3
> conn = sqlite3.connect("app/db.sqlite3")
> # Must replace your project_id here (e.g. from url in web app)
> rows = conn.execute("SELECT id, text FROM api_label WHERE project_id = 5;").fetchall()
> print({k: v for k,v in rows})
> '
> EOF
> ```
> 
> Do not forget to adjust the project id :)

Very nice workaround. It works like a charm. Thanks !

issue.title: How to get the id of all labels?

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body: In the past version, we can get the version by the method mentioned in #295 . However, in the latest version, there are three docker containers, how can i get the id of all labels? Thanks a lot.
